page.title: 06Lymm Parish Council.
page.content: We interviewed{Mr.Thomason}who is a governor of our school and also a member of the{Parish}Council.There has been a Parish Council in Lymm for 11 years, and before that it was an Urban District Council. There are 12 members who represent about 12000 people.The only qualification for becoming a member is that you have to live in Lymm. and be eighteen years of age.The council is responsible for areas such as toilets, bus stops , Lymm Dam and any other matters which affect the community.Members are elected for four years and only the Tory,Liberal and SDP are represented at the moment. The Council Offices are on Whitbarrow Road. The Council have introduced a Retail Trading Policy to attract more shops to the Village.
